**Senior Research Economist \| Statistics Canada, Ottawa, Canada**\
[Michael.Willox@statcan.gc.ca](mailto:Michael.Willox@statcan.gc.ca)\

**Doctoral Researcher \| Brunel University, London, UK**\
[Michael.Willox@brunel.ac.uk](mailto:Michael.Willox\@brunel.ac.uk)\

[LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/michael-willox) \| [GitHub](https://github.com/MichaelWillox) \| [Google Scholar](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=ufTAM-AAAAAJ&hl=en) \| [ORCID](https://orcid.org/my-orcid?orcid=0000-0003-2738-5994) \| [RePEc](https://authors.repec.org/pro/pwi388/)
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Work Experience

### Senior Research Economist

**Statistics Canada, Ottawa, Canada**

*Dec 2013 – Present*

-   Conducts medium and long-term economic analysis on economic and environmental issues to support Statistics Canada’s research agenda.

-   Performs impact evaluations for federal government departments.

-   Manages projects with multidisciplinary teams on a variety of projects such as building and maintaining a world-class economic and environmental database.

-   Built and maintains an online productivity benchmarking tool for Canadian businesses.

-   Developed data series for the Canadian System of National Accounts to support policy development.

### Senior Economist

**Finance Canada, Ottawa, Canada**

*Nov 2006 – Dec 2013*

-   Contributed to the development and coordination of the Federal Government of Canada’s annual Budgets and Economic Updates.

-   Conducted economic analysis on productivity, competition, and labor markets.

-   Provided analysis and briefings on U.S. monetary policy and global economic events.

### Economist

**Environment and Climate Change Canada, Ottawa, Canada**

*Jul 2005 – Nov 2006*

-   Conducted policy research and developed Greenhouse Gas (GHG) and clean air emissions forecasts using the Energy 2020 model.

-   Coordinated briefing materials for senior management.

### Economist

**Natural Resources Canada, Ottawa, Canada**

*Dec 2003 – Jun 2005*

-   Conducted policy research on economic and financial issues facing Canada’s energy sector.

-   Developed responses to public inquiries on behalf of the Minister.

### Program Evaluation Analyst

**Health Canada Departmental Program Evaluation Division, Ottawa, Canada**

*Jun 2002 – Nov 2003*

-   Lead analyst for the evaluation of the Primary Health Care Transition Fund and Alcohol and Drug Rehabilitation Program.

-   Prepared Treasury Board Submissions.

## Education

-   **PhD in Economics and Finance**, Brunel University London, London, UK (Oct 2023 – Present)

-   **Canadian Securities Course**, Canadian Securities Institute, Ottawa, Canada (Oct 2004)

-   **MA in Economics**, McGill University, Montréal, Canada (Apr 2003)

-   **BA (Hons) in Economics**, University of Regina, Regina, Canada (Oct 1996)

-   **BA in Political Science**, University of Regina, Regina, Canada (Apr 1994)

## Computer Skills

-   Office Productivity: Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint

-   Statistical Software: R, R Studio, Shiny, SAS, Stata, Git, GitHub, GitLab, Python

## Publications

Gu, W., & Willox, M. (2023). The Post-2001 Productivity Growth Divergence between Canada and the United States. *International Productivity Monitor*, *45*, 27-60. [Link](http://csls.ca/ipm/45/IPM_45_Gu.pdf).

Kumbhakar, S. C., Badunenko, O., & Willox, M. (2022). Do carbon taxes affect economic and environmental efficiency? The case of British Columbia’s manufacturing plants. *Energy Economics*, *115*, 106359. [Link](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.eneco.2022.106359).

Liu, Huju, Lu, Y., & Willox, M. (2021). "Use of the Canada Emergency Wage Subsidy program by employer businesses in 2020." Ottawa: Statistics Canada, Economic and Social Reports, Catalogue Number 36-28-0001. [Link](https://doi.org/10.25318/36280001202100600006-eng).

Lafrance-Cooke , A. , Macdonald, R., & Willox, M. (2020). "Monthly Business Openings and Closures: Experimental Series for Canada, the Provinces and Territories, and Census Metropolitan Areas.” Economic Insights, No. 116. Statistics Canada Cat. No. 11-626-X. [Link](https://www150.statcan.gc.ca/n1/pub/11-626-x/11-626-x2020014-eng.htm).

Gu, W., Hussain, J., & Willox, M. (2019). *Environmentally adjusted multifactor productivity growth for the Canadian manufacturing sector*. Statistics Canada. [Link](https://www150.statcan.gc.ca/n1/pub/11f0019m/11f0019m2019013-eng.htm).

Gu, W., & Willox, M. (2018). Productivity Growth in Canada and the United States: Recent Industry Trends and Potential Explanations. *International Productivity Monitor*, *35*, 73-94. [Link](https://www.csls.ca/ipm/35/Gu-Willox.pdf).

Baldwin, J. R., & Willox, M. (2016). The industry origins of Canada's weaker labour productivity performance and the role of structural adjustment in the post-2000 period. *International Productivity Monitor, (31), 19-37.* [Link](https://www.csls.ca/ipm/31/baldwin.pdf).

## Awards

-   Statistics Canada Award of Excellence: Excellence in Project Delivery, 2017

-   Statistics Canada Award of Excellence: Outstanding Contribution Award, 2020
